adjective.description: Resembling, characteristic of, or associated with the Pope, papal, papistical; having quasi-papal power or authority.

adverb.description: In a manner befitting or suggestive of a pope; like a pope; papally.

origin: Mid 16th century; earliest use found in Thomas Becon (1512/13–1567), theologian and Church of England clergyman. From pope + -like.
